snippet: Islamic State victories against the Taliban have not weakened the overall insurgency, but have mostly inflicted more chaos and misery upon Afghan civilians.
abstract: Islamic State has made major gains in its territorial fight against local Taliban units in Afghanistan; conflict, rather than weakening overall insurgency by dividing it, has made life worse for ordinary citizens; ISIS has wielded control of its territories with characteristic brutality, often executing anyone with ties to government or Taliban.

byline.contributor: Khalid Alokozay contributed reporting from Jalalabad, Afghanistan, and Ben Hubbard from Beirut, Lebanon.

lead_paragraph: Islamic State victories against the Taliban have not weakened the overall insurgency, but have mostly inflicted more chaos and misery upon Afghan civilians.

headline.main: Afghan ISIS Branch Makes Inroads in Battle Against Taliban
headline.print_headline: Afghan Chaos Swells as ISIS Makes Inroads
